member.name: T:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_IO_REQUEST
member.summary: The SCARD_IO_REQUEST structure begins a protocol control information structure. Any protocol-specific information then immediately follows this structure. The entire length of the structure must be aligned with the underlying hardware architecture word size. For example, in Win32 the length of any PCI information must be a multiple of four bytes so that it aligns on a 32-bit boundary.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_IO_REQUEST.dwProtocol
member.summary: Protocol in use.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_IO_REQUEST.cbPciLength
member.summary: Length, in bytes, of the SCARD_IO_REQUEST structure plus any following PCI-specific information.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.APDURec.bCLA
member.summary: The T=0 instruction class.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.APDURec.bINS
member.summary: An instruction code in the T=0 instruction class.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.APDURec.bP1
member.summary: Reference codes that complete the instruction code.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.APDURec.bP2
member.summary: Reference codes that complete the instruction code.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.APDURec.bP3
member.summary: The number of data bytes to be transmitted during the command, per ISO 7816-4, Section 8.2.1.

member.name: T:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE
member.summary: The SCARD_READERSTATE structure is used by functions for tracking smart cards within readers.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.RdrName
member.summary: Pointer to the name of the reader being monitored.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.UserData
member.summary: Not used by the smart card subsystem. This member is used by the application.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.RdrCurrState
member.summary: Current state of the reader, as seen by the application. This field can take on any of the following values, in combination, as a bit mask.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.RdrEventState
member.summary: Current state of the reader, as known by the smart card resource manager. This field can take on any of the following values, in combination, as a bit mask.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.ATRLength
member.summary: Number of bytes in the returned ATR.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE.ATRValue
member.summary: ATR of the inserted card, with extra alignment bytes.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SCOPE_USER
member.summary: The context is a user context, and any database operations are performed within the domain of the user.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SCOPE_TERMINAL
member.summary: The context is that of the current terminal, and any database operations are performed within the domain of that terminal. (The calling application must have appropriate access permissions for any database actions.)

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SCOPE_SYSTEM
member.summary: The context is the system context, and any database operations are performed within the domain of the system. (The calling application must have appropriate access permissions for any database actions.)

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_UNAWARE
member.summary: The application is unaware of the current state, and would like to know. The use of this value results in an immediate return from state transition monitoring services. This is represented by all bits set to zero.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_IGNORE
member.summary: The application requested that this reader be ignored. No other bits will be set.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_CHANGED
member.summary: This implies that there is a difference between the state believed by the application, and the state known by the Service Manager.When this bit is set, the application may assume a significant state change has occurred on this reader.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_UNKNOWN
member.summary: This implies that the given reader name is not recognized by the Service Manager. If this bit is set, then SCARD_STATE_CHANGED and SCARD_STATE_IGNORE will also be set.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: This implies that the actual state of this reader is not available. If this bit is set, then all the following bits are clear.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_EMPTY
member.summary: This implies that there is not card in the reader. If this bit is set, all the following bits will be clear.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_PRESENT
member.summary: This implies that there is a card in the reader.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_ATRMATCH
member.summary: This implies that there is a card in the reader with an ATR matching one of the target cards. If this bit is set, SCARD_STATE_PRESENT will also be set. This bit is only returned on the SCardLocateCard() service.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: This implies that the card in the reader is allocated for exclusive use by another application. If this bit is set, SCARD_STATE_PRESENT will also be set.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_INUSE
member.summary: This implies that the card in the reader is in use by one or more other applications, but may be connected to in shared mode. If this bit is set, SCARD_STATE_PRESENT will also be set.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_MUTE
member.summary: This implies that the card in the reader is unresponsive or not supported by the reader or software.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_STATE_UNPOWERED
member.summary: This implies that the card in the reader has not been powered up.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SHARE_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: This application is not willing to share this card with other applications.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SHARE_SHARED
member.summary: This application is willing to share this card with other applications.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SHARE_DIRECT
member.summary: This application demands direct control of the reader, so it is not available to other applications.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_LEAVE_CARD
member.summary: Don't do anything special on close

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_RESET_CARD
member.summary: Reset the card on close

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_UNPOWER_CARD
member.summary: Power down the card on close

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_EJECT_CARD
member.summary: Eject the card on close

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PROTOCOL_UNDEFINED
member.summary: There is no active protocol.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PROTOCOL_T0
member.summary: T=0 is the active protocol.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PROTOCOL_T1
member.summary: T=1 is the active protocol.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PROTOCOL_RAW
member.summary: Raw is the active protocol.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PROTOCOL_DEFAULT
member.summary: Use implicit PTS.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_UNKNOWN
member.summary: This value implies the driver is unaware of the current state of the reader.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_ABSENT
member.summary: This value implies there is no card in the reader.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_PRESENT
member.summary: This value implies there is a card is present in the reader, but that it has not been moved into position for use.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SWALLOWED
member.summary: This value implies there is a card in the reader in position for use. The card is not powered.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_POWERED
member.summary: This value implies there is power is being provided to the card, but the Reader Driver is unaware of the mode of the card.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_NEGOTIABLE
member.summary: This value implies the card has been reset and is awaiting PTS negotiation.

member.name: F:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCARD_SPECIFIC
member.summary: This value implies the card has been reset and specific communication protocols have been established.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardEstablishContext(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardEstablishContext function establishes the resource manager context (the scope) within which database operations are performed.
member.param: [in] Scope of the resource manager context. This parameter can be one of the following values.
[in] Reserved for future use and must be NULL. This parameter will allow a suitably privileged management application to act on behalf of another user.
[in] Reserved for future use and must be NULL.
[out] Handle to the established resource manager context. This handle can now be supplied to other functions attempting to do work within this context.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardReleaseContext(System.Int32)
member.summary: The SCardReleaseContext function closes an established resource manager context, freeing any resources allocated under that context, including SCARDHANDLE objects and memory allocated using the SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE length designator.
member.param: [in] Handle that identifies the resource manager context. The resource manager context is set by a previous call to SCardEstablishContext.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardConnect(System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardConnect function establishes a connection (using a specific resource manager context) between the calling application and a smart card contained by a specific reader. If no card exists in the specified reader, an error is returned.
member.param: [in] A handle that identifies the resource manager context. The resource manager context is set by a previous call to SCardEstablishContext.
[in] The name of the reader that contains the target card.
[in] A flag that indicates whether other applications may form connections to the card.
[in] A bit mask of acceptable protocols for the connection. Possible values may be combined with the OR operation.
[out] A handle that identifies the connection to the smart card in the designated reader.
[out] A flag that indicates the established active protocol.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardDisconnect(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SCardDisconnect function terminates a connection previously opened between the calling application and a smart card in the target reader.
member.param: [in] Reference value obtained from a previous call to SCardConnect.
[in] Action to take on the card in the connected reader on close.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardListReaderGroups(System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardListReaderGroups function provides the list of reader groups that have previously been introduced to the system.
member.param: [in] Handle that identifies the resource manager context for the query. The resource manager context can be set by a previous call to SCardEstablishContext. This parameter cannot be NULL.

[out] Multi-string that lists the reader groups defined to the system and available to the current user on the current terminal. If this value is NULL, SCardListReaderGroups ignores the buffer length supplied in pcchGroups, writes the length of the buffer that would have been returned if this parameter had not been NULL to pcchGroups, and returns a success code.

[in, out] Length of the mszGroups buffer in characters, and receives the actual length of the multi-string structure, including all trailing null characters. If the buffer length is specified as SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE, then mszGroups is converted to a pointer to a byte pointer, and receives the address of a block of memory containing the multi-string structure. This block of memory must be deallocated with SCardFreeMemory.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardBeginTransaction(System.Int32)
member.summary: The SCardBeginTransaction function starts a transaction, waiting for the completion of all other transactions before it begins. When the transaction starts, all other applications are blocked from accessing the smart card while the transaction is in progress.
member.param: [in] Reference value obtained from a previous call to SCardConnect.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardEndTransaction(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SCardEndTransaction function completes a previously declared transaction, allowing other applications to resume interactions with the card.
member.param: [in] Reference value obtained from a previous call to SCardConnect. This value would also have been used in an earlier call to SCardBeginTransaction.
[in] Action to take on the card in the connected reader on close.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardStatus(System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Byte@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardStatus function provides the current status of a smart card in a reader. You can call it any time after a successful call to SCardConnect and before a successful call to SCardDisconnect. It does not affect the state of the reader or reader driver.
member.param: [in] Reference value returned from SCardConnect.
[out] List of friendly names (multiple string) by which the currently connected reader is known.

[in, out] On input, supplies the length of the szReaderName buffer. On output, receives the actual length (in characters) of the reader name list, including the trailing NULL character. If this buffer length is specified as SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE, then szReaderName is converted to a pointer to a byte pointer, and it receives the address of a block of memory that contains the multiple-string structure.
[out] Current state of the smart card in the reader. Upon success, it receives one of the following state indicators.
[out] Current protocol, if any. The returned value is meaningful only if the returned value of pdwState is SCARD_SPECIFICMODE.
[out] Pointer to a 32-byte buffer that receives the ATR string from the currently inserted card, if available.

[in, out] On input, supplies the length of the pbAtr buffer. On output, receives the number of bytes in the ATR string (32 bytes maximum). If this buffer length is specified as SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE, then pbAtr is converted to a pointer to a byte pointer, and it receives the address of a block of memory that contains the multiple-string structure.
member.returns: If the function successfully provides the current status of a smart card in a reader, the return value is SCARD_S_SUCCESS. If the function fails, it returns an error code. For more information, see Smart Card Return Values.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardTransmit(System.Int32,AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_IO_REQUEST@,System.Byte@,System.Int32,AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_IO_REQUEST@,System.Byte@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardTransmit function sends a service request to the smart card and expects to receive data back from the card.
member.param: [in] A reference value returned from the SCardConnect function.

[in] A pointer to the protocol header structure for the instruction. This buffer is in the format of an SCARD_IO_REQUEST structure, followed by the specific protocol control information (PCI). For the T=0, T=1, and Raw protocols, the PCI structure is constant. The smart card subsystem supplies a global T=0, T=1, or Raw PCI structure, which you can reference by using the symbols SCARD_PCI_T0, SCARD_PCI_T1, and SCARD_PCI_RAW respectively.
[in] A pointer to the actual data to be written to the card.
[in] The length, in bytes, of the pbSendBuffer parameter.

[in, out] Pointer to the protocol header structure for the instruction, followed by a buffer in which to receive any returned protocol control information (PCI) specific to the protocol in use. This parameter can be NULL if no PCI is returned.
[out] Pointer to any data returned from the card.

[in, out] Supplies the length, in bytes, of the pbRecvBuffer parameter and receives the actual number of bytes received from the smart card. This value cannot be SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE because SCardTransmit does not support SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE.
member.returns: If the function successfully sends a service request to the smart card, the return value is SCARD_S_SUCCESS. If the function fails, it returns an error code. For more information, see Smart Card Return Values.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardListReaders(System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardListReaders function provides the list of readers within a set of named reader groups, eliminating duplicates. The caller supplies a list of reader groups, and receives the list of readers within the named groups. Unrecognized group names are ignored.
member.param: [in] Handle that identifies the resource manager context for the query. The resource manager context can be set by a previous call to SCardEstablishContext. This parameter cannot be NULL.
[in] Names of the reader groups defined to the system, as a multi-string. Use a NULL value to list all readers in the system (that is, the SCard$AllReaders group).

[out] Multi-string that lists the card readers within the supplied reader groups. If this value is NULL, SCardListReaders ignores the buffer length supplied in pcchReaders, writes the length of the buffer that would have been returned if this parameter had not been NULL to pcchReaders, and returns a success code.

[in, out] Length of the mszReaders buffer in characters. This parameter receives the actual length of the multi-string structure, including all trailing null characters. If the buffer length is specified as SCARD_AUTOALLOCATE, then mszReaders is converted to a pointer to a byte pointer, and receives the address of a block of memory containing the multi-string structure. This block of memory must be deallocated with SCardFreeMemory.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardGetStatusChange(System.Int32,System.Int32,AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.SCARD_READERSTATE@,System.Int32)
member.summary: The SCardGetStatusChange function blocks execution until the current availability of the cards in a specific set of readers changes.
member.param: [in] Handle that identifies the resource manager context. The resource manager context is set by a previous call to SCardEstablishContext.
[in] Maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait for an action. A value of zero causes the function to return immediately. A value of INFINITE causes this function never to time out.
[in, out] Array of SCARD_READERSTATE structures that specify the readers to watch, and receives the result.
[in] Number of elements in the rgReaderStates array.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.SCardControl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte@,System.Int32,System.Byte@,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The SCardControl function gives you direct control of the reader. You can call it any time after a successful call to SCardConnect and before a successful call to SCardDisconnect. The effect on the state of the reader depends on the control code.
member.param: [in] Reference value returned from SCardConnect.
[in] Control code for the operation. This value identifies the specific operation to be performed.
[in] Pointer to a buffer that contains the data required to perform the operation. This parameter can be NULL if the dwControlCode parameter specifies an operation that does not require input data.
[in] Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpInBuffer.
[out] Pointer to a buffer that receives the operation's output data. This parameter can be NULL if the dwControlCode parameter specifies an operation that does not produce output data.
[in] Size, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by lpOutBuffer.
[out] Pointer to a DWORD that receives the size, in bytes, of the data stored into the buffer pointed to by lpOutBuffer.
member.returns: This function returns different values depending on whether it succeeds or fails.

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.GetScardErrMsg(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the specific error message
member.param: The error code

member.name: M:AFPSLAI_EVOLISPRIMACY.ModWinsCard.LoadListControl(System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox,System.String)
member.summary: Load the list from 2nd parameter (readerList) to the ComboBox control from 1st Parameter (ctrl)
member.param: The ComboBox control where do you want to load the list of reader
The string variable that contains the list of readers
